DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Tumor Panel Sequencing Performed Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric percentage value of the tumor panel sequencing laboratory procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Tumor Panel Sequencing Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._An application of next-generation targeted sequencing where tumor-specific genes are selected for sequencing. Using next-generation techniques, chosen sequences can be sequenced to high depths that facilitate the identification of variants that are present at low allele frequencies._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: An application of next-generation targeted sequencing where tumor-specific genes are selected for sequencing. ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed that is a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
